correctionPatterns.note: High signal density - corrections found in 20+ sessions
correctionPatterns.observation: Common patterns: Claude making assumptions without asking, proceeding with implementation choices before validation

promptingPatterns.observation: User provides detailed context and requirements, but Claude sometimes proceeds without clarifying edge cases

majorDecisions: Memory optimization strategy for 5000+ row datasets

prsWithExternalReviews.title: fix: notebook and metadata browser improvements (v0.3.3)

keyFindings.issue: Hardcoded connection URL and tenant ID - security risk
withFilteredColumns method appears unused - potential dead code
Environment-specific connection strings should not be committed
Currency symbol detection only checks start of string, not end/middle
Test notebook contains hardcoded environment-specific metadata
Unique ID uses timestamp+random - possible collision in same millisecond
Generic raw DTO extraction assumes all types have _rawDto - silent failure if mapper doesn't set it
Comparison between inconvertible types (date vs null)

prsWithExternalReviews.title: fix: v0.3.2 - Memory optimization and IntelliSense fixes

keyFindings.issue: Inconsistency in virtual scroll handler implementation

prsWithExternalReviews.title: Release v0.3.0 - Data Explorer, Web Resources & Metadata Browser

ciSummary.observation: CI pipeline is fully stable - all recent runs successful

processSuccesses: High PR merge rate (19/20 in period)
Stable CI pipeline (100% success in last 15 runs)
Active use of external code review tools (Gemini, Copilot, GitHub Advanced Security)
Effective use of worktrees for parallel development (5 active worktrees)
Bundle size monitoring automated in CI
processFailures: Extended thinking rarely used (1/344 sessions) - underutilized for complex decisions
.mcp.json committed with sensitive data - security finding from both Gemini and Copilot
Potential dead code (withFilteredColumns) shipped - should have been caught in review
Silent failure mode in raw DTO extraction - defensive coding gap
codeGuardianGaps: Did not catch .mcp.json security concern (sensitive data in committed files)
Did not catch potential dead code in QueryResult.ts
Did not catch silent failure mode in MetadataBrowserPanel.ts
Did not catch type comparison issue in MetadataBrowserBehavior.js
potentialImprovements: Add .mcp.json to .gitignore and use local config template
Update code-guardian to check for committed sensitive files
Update code-guardian to run ts-prune for dead code detection
Consider adding defensive null checks when accessing rawDto
Use extended thinking more for complex architectural decisions
Review if /design command is being used enough before complex features
